topic.name: Online Safety & Security
topic.description: 13-year academic progression (K-12) for Online Safety & Security in Computing & Digital Technologies

objectives.objective_text: Recall that real people are behind the screen.
Identify the difference between teasing and bullying.
Identify that the internet remembers things.
Name 'Footprint' as a trail we leave.
Identify a password as a secret key.
Recall that we don't share passwords with friends.
Name a safe person to share secrets with (parents).
Summarize strong password rules (letters, numbers, symbols).
Tell an adult if someone is unkind.
Explain how to block or report a bully.
Defend the victim through appropriate channels.
Put the tablet away when called.
Summarize why screens make us lose track of time.
Defend the need for solitude and deep work.
Name a computer virus (makes it sick).
Summarize the 'Grandma Rule' (don't post what Grandma shouldn't see).
Explain that deleting doesn't always mean gone.
Check privacy settings on a game.
Defend the value of privacy in a surveillance economy.
Defend the use of biometric authentication.
Keep my name and address secret.
Explain why games ask for your birthday.
Analyze the impact of anonymity on behavior.
Interpret the legal consequences of harassment.
Analyze the dopamine loop (why likes feel good).
Recall that strangers online might not be who they say.
Analyze the permanence of digital data.
Interpret how data is collected by cookies.
Connect social media posts to future job prospects.
Analyze the strength of a password against brute force.
Connect unique passwords to preventing chain hacks.
Analyze app permissions (does a flashlight need contacts?).
Connect free apps to selling data.
Evaluate the mental health impact of cyberbullying.
Evaluate the persuasive design of social media.
Explain why we don't download free stuff from weird sites.
Evaluate the right to be forgotten.
Evaluate the trade-off between convenience and security.
Evaluate the trade-off of personalization vs. privacy.
Construct a personal code of conduct for online discourse.
Synthesize conflict resolution skills in digital spaces.
Compare a safe site vs. a risky one.
Connect clicking links to drive-by downloads.
Construct a strategy for digital reputation management.
Construct a privacy audit of personal devices.
Construct a defense plan against identity theft.
